alert.note: Alert for Tavaputs Plateau (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 27 at 4:14PM MST until February 28 at 6:00PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST TUESDAY ABOVE 7500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected above 7500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches with locally higher amounts possible especially for the Flat Tops. Winds gusting as 45 to 55 mph at times on Tuesday. * WHERE...In Colorado, Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus and Flat Tops. In Utah, Tavaputs Plateau. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on icy to snowpacked road conditions. Blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility, especially on ridge tops and mountain passes. A detailed map of the snowfall can be found at: www.weather.gov/gjt/winter. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest wind gusts are expected above 9000 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
